title: The REAL Phreaker's Guide Part II
historical_context: This article is a continuation of a previous guide aimed at phreakers, reflecting the culture and attitudes of the hacking community in the early 1980s.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and those interested in hacker culture.
short_summary: This article humorously critiques the behaviors and attitudes of self-proclaimed elite phreakers, using a satirical tone to highlight what it means to be truly elite in the hacking community.
summary: In 'The REAL Phreaker's Guide Part II', Taran King and Knight Lightning delve into the characteristics that define a true elite phreaker, contrasting them with those who merely claim the title. The authors employ a satirical lens to poke fun at various individuals and behaviors within the phreaking community, emphasizing that real phreaks do not flaunt their skills or engage in self-aggrandizing antics. Instead, they embody a certain humility and authenticity that sets them apart from the pretenders. The article is filled with humorous anecdotes and corollaries that illustrate the absurdities of the phreaking culture, particularly targeting a figure named Oryan Quest as a case study of what not to be.
